segments.text: Ugh, this kitchen is turning into a disgusting swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water gushing from the sink, soaking everything in sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's foot is in that filthy puddle—how can she not notice?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her towel is probably getting damp from the splashes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cabinets dripping, floor slick with grime now mixing in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids—climbing on a stool into that cookie jar like animals.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy's hands all over the cookies, who knows if they're clean.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching too, probably dropping crumbs everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Open cabinet doors framing this messy theft—revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked near the flood zone, ready to get ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the pretty garden outside can't redeem this indoor filth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel queasy just looking at the water pooling up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Turn off that faucet before it gets worse!
segments.speaker: PAR
